pdgm.pdgmnote: Tosco2007b p. 515. The future and habitual template paradigms are not given as such in the source,but are an extrapolation from the following statement of the author:Two affixes,-n- for the future and –ay- for the Habitual,may be inserted between the stem and the Prefective,Imperfective,and Negative endings.

pdgm.pdgmnote: Tosco2007b 3.3.3 (pp. 515f). In sentence coordination,the first sentence is in the main paradigm floowed by the general linker –pa;the following sentence is in the dependent paradigm,irrspective of the tense of the main verb.
Tosco2007b Table 4 (p. 515). There are two tonally distinct inflectional classes of verb in the perfective,imperative,and consecutive positive tenses.

Tosco2007b p. 515. The future and habitual template paradigms are not given as such in the source,but are an extrapolation from the following statement of the author:Two affixes,-n- for the future and –ay- for the Habitual,may be inserted between the stem and the Prefective,Imperfective,and Negative endings.
Tosco2007b Table 5 (p. 515). There are two tonally distinct inflectional classes of verb in the perfective,imperative,and consecutive positive tenses.
Tosco2007b 3.3.5 (p. 517). Imperative classes do not exist in the negative imperative (note classes of lexical items in the affirmative imperative). A single verb form used in both sg and pl.
Tosco2007b Table 6 and 3.34 (pp. 516f). Class1a verbs are C final;class1b are CC final.
